In the UK they basically allowed university admittance on 'predicted' or teachers grades. You can imagine how many completely intellectually unsuitable candidates were permitted entry this year... I raise this not because I don't trust teachers but because in class sizes as large and varied and where they teach so many kids each day/week/year how on earth can they give a fair, un-compromised, in-depth analysis of each kid?  I really think the repercussions will be enormous when all these dimwits will scrape through university because of grade inflation and come out worth shit in terms of skill and knowledge and worse still, with such arrogance that they deserved their little paper validating their 'studies' in the first place.
